data.persistant

Class Persistent

  • java.lang.Object
    • data.persistant.Persistent

  • public class Persistent
extends Object
    static class for keeping track of preferences, file paths etc
    Author:
    SamSchofield

    • Method Detail

      • setFilePath

        public static void setFilePath(String filePath)
                        throws FileNotFoundException
        Sets the FilePath preference to a Fitr directory at location of filePath Will only set a valid file path
        Parameters:
        filePath - location on users computer where they want Fitr to be saved
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException

      • setupDirectory

        public static void setupDirectory()
        sets up a new Fitr directory at the file path if filePath has been set

      • getFilePath

        public static String getFilePath()
        gets the file path to the Fitr directory from preferences
        Returns:
        FilePath

      • getProfileFilePath

        public static String getProfileFilePath(String userID)
        returns the file path to the current users profile within the Fitr directory. user profile sub directories are named as the users ID number
        Returns:
        profileFilePath

      • filePathSet

        public static boolean filePathSet()
        checks if a valid file path has been set. Used to determine if we need to ask the user to set their file path when opening the program
        Returns:
        pathSet

      • newUser

        public static boolean newUser(User user)
        creates a new directory in users with name userID to store user information in. also adds a userID.json The usedID.json is hidden on OSX and Linux OS so that users can't corrupt their data The user will only be added if that user doesn't already exist
        Parameters:
        User - the user to be added
        Returns:
        boolean if the user to be added or not

      • generateUserID

        public static String generateUserID()
        generates a unique UserID using UUID
        Returns:
        unique userID

      • setUser

        public static void setUser(User user)
        Sets the current user. Will only set the current user if the user is existing
        Parameters:
        user -

        returns the current user
        Returns:
